title: TGfU Instructional Design Workshop and Language Assessment Rubric Development for Game-Centered Physical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of intermediate-level professional knowledge and problem-solving skills, with experience in designing basic physical education terminology and language assessment tools
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented course for strengthening game-based pedagogy implementation in online asynchronous environments. Focus on improving strategic communication skills in language learning contexts. Includes training for ensuring clarity and objectivity in assessment language when developing rubrics.

learning_goals: Designing a physical education lesson plan incorporating the 6-step TGfU model (Game Form, Game Understanding, Tactical Awareness, Decision-Making, Skill Execution, Performance Evaluation) and integrating verbal feedback strategies

Development of at least three interactive simulation materials for game-based problem-solving activities in online environments (including text-based scenarios, role-play dialogues, and strategic communication tasks)

Learners can develop two rubrics for individual/team assessments suitable for vocational training language learning contexts within one week. Each rubric must include clear evaluation criteria and weighted scales (1-5 points) measuring student engagement (4 indicators: frequency of speech, diversity of questions, collaborative expressions, feedback utilization) and strategic thinking (3 indicators: tactical vocabulary use, logical explanation, creative problem-solving)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
